repnme.cdata!:
Sierra Leone - Second Public Sector
            Management Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Public Sector Management
            Support Project for Sierra Leone had the following ratings:
            the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development impact was substantial, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            The lessons learned indicate that when project components
            reflect the highest priorities of a Government,
            implementation is easier and faster as ownership is assured
            at all levels. In a country with weak capacity in the public
            service, it is important that the project designs are kept
            simple with well defined components. In a post conflict
            country where capacity is very weak, it is essential to
            provide a short term capacity building support whilst a long
            term strategy is developed build institutional capacity. In
            a post conflict country, a clear and well defined transition
            arrangement needs to be made to ensure sustainability of projects.
